title: FBI vexsome filer list

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI vexsome filer list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent copy of the "vexsome filer list" which may also be known as a "High Volume Requestors" list, "serial filer list" or a "nuisance filer list." Include any other list of FOIA requesters used by your agency which lists FOIA requesters because of the quantity or type of FOIA requests they have submit or any other FOIA related behavior. Please include any FBI or DOJ originated materials describing the list, its purpose, its meaning, and/or how it is used.

I am a member of the press and request classification as such.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffbi-vexsome-filer-list-101730%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1kDeNy%3A4sSm5Xa_orrgeF-EJfvmFVZETCY

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Wildwood, Missouri Proposed Solar Ordinance Artifacts

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Wildwood, Missouri Proposed Solar Ordinance Artifacts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the following with regards to the city's proposed solar ordinance:

1. A copy of the draft ordinance, including any revisions or amendments made during the drafting process.
2. Supporting materials or documents related to the proposed ordinance, such as studies, reports, expert opinions, or other materials that provide context, justification, or evidence supporting the need for the proposed ordinance.
3. Meeting minutes or transcripts from meetings where the proposed ordinance has been discussed.
4. Relevant emails, letters, or other communications ("correspondence and communications") between city officials, policymakers, and stakeholders discussing the proposed ordinance. This can include (but not limited to) communications between city council members, city staff, consultants, interest groups, or members of the public.
5. Impact assessments conducted to evaluate the potential impact of the proposed ordinance, including (but not limited to) economic impact studies, environmental assessments, or other evaluations that examine the consequences, benefits, or drawbacks of implementing the proposed ordinance.
6. Legal opinions sought or commissioned regarding the proposed ordinance.
7. Public comments, feedback received, or any public hearings that have been held on the proposed ordinance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

Mr. Galbraith,

I am in receipt of your records request which was received by my office on July 13, 2023.

I am interpreting your request to be pertaining only to Bill #2799, which is the proposed ordinance regarding solar system regulations in the City of Wildwood. If my understanding is incorrect, please let me know.

Video of the public hearing can be found here: May 8, 2023 City Council Meeting - YouTube<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4cMnmlSYMpY>

I will be providing one additional attachment in a separate e-mail due to the file size.

Due to the scope of your request, additional time is needed to research, review, and produce additional records you requested. It is estimated that the records would be made available to you within one week. If payment is needed to cover actual costs incurred by the City in processing your request, you will be advised and required to remit payment prior to the City releasing the records to you.
Thanks!

communications.subject: RE: Online Form Submittal: Request for Public Records
communications.communication:
Mr. Galbraith,

In regards to your request for “Relevant emails, letters, or other communications ("correspondence and communications") between city officials, policymakers, and stakeholders discussing the proposed ordinance. This can include (but not limited to) communications between city council members, city staff, consultants, interest groups, or members of the public”, in accordance with Section 610.026, RSMo., the City of Wildwood may collect fees for the actual cost of document research and duplication incurred by the City prior to providing the requested public records.

The estimated cost to research, review, and produce the records you requested is as follows:

1 hour of City Clerk’s Office staff time @ $26.97/hr = $26.97

Total: $26.97

Payment can be made at City Hall between the hours of 8 a.m. and 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, via cash or check made payable to the City of Wildwood.

Checks may also be mailed to:
City of Wildwood
16860 Main Street
Wildwood, MO 63040

If additional payment is needed to cover actual costs incurred by the City in processing your request, you will be advised and required to remit payment of the balance prior to the City releasing the records to you. If the estimated fee exceeds the cost of providing the records to you, the City will refund the difference to you.

Once payment has been received, the City will begin our compilation of the public records requested and make the records available to you upon completion. It is estimated that the records would be made available to you within two business days after payment has been received.


Please also note, some records may be closed or contain exempt material pursuant to Sections 610.021(1) RSMo., therefore additional time may be utilized for those records to be reviewed and for any exempt material to be redacted consistent with the requirements of Section 610.024, RSMo. The review of these items should be completed within one week after payment has been received.

Thank you!


[Image result for wildwood mo logo]
Megan Eldridge, MRCC
City Clerk
City of Wildwood
16860 Main Street<https://goo.gl/maps/nUqBDAkjnNE2>
Wildwood, MO 63040-1242<https://goo.gl/maps/nUqBDAkjnNE2>
636-405-2029

communications.subject: RE: Online Form Submittal: Request for Public Records
communications.communication:
Mr. Galbraith,

My response to your records request is outlined below in red. As mentioned previously, I am interpreting your request to be pertaining only to Bill #2799, which is the proposed ordinance regarding solar system regulations in the City of Wildwood. If my understanding is incorrect, please let me know.

1. A copy of the draft ordinance, including any revisions or amendments made during the drafting process. I have provided you the draft ordinance. Further, the City has no records responsive to the remainder of your request at this time.
2. Supporting materials or documents related to the proposed ordinance, such as studies, reports, expert opinions, or other materials that provide context, justification, or evidence supporting the need for the proposed ordinance. I have provided you records regarding Bill #2799 that are responsive to this request.
3. Meeting minutes or transcripts from meetings where the proposed ordinance has been discussed. I have provided you records regarding Bill #2799 that are responsive to this request.
4. Relevant emails, letters, or other communications ("correspondence and communications") between city officials, policymakers, and stakeholders discussing the proposed ordinance. This can include (but not limited to) communications between city council members, city staff, consultants, interest groups, or members of the public. Due to the file size, I will be sending a link for you to access the records responsive to this request.
5. Impact assessments conducted to evaluate the potential impact of the proposed ordinance, including (but not limited to) economic impact studies, environmental assessments, or other evaluations that examine the consequences, benefits, or drawbacks of implementing the proposed ordinance. The City has no records responsive to your request.
6. Legal opinions sought or commissioned regarding the proposed ordinance.  To the extent any such records exist, they are closed records pursuant to Section 610.021.1, RSMo.
7. Public comments, feedback received, or any public hearings that have been held on the proposed ordinance. I have provided you records and a link regarding Bill #2799 that are responsive to this request.

[Image result for wildwood mo logo]
Megan Eldridge, MRCC
City Clerk
City of Wildwood
16860 Main Street<https://goo.gl/maps/nUqBDAkjnNE2>
Wildwood, MO 63040-1242<https://goo.gl/maps/nUqBDAkjnNE2>
